Description: Binary [yes / no] If the student's father works as a teacher, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.

Binary [yes / no] Concerning the education of the student's mother. If the student's mother had only poor education (no education or only Primary school education until 4th grade), the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the job of the student's mother. If the student's mother is a house wife and not otherwise employed, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.

Binary [yes / no] Concerning the job of the student's mother. If the student's works in neither teaching, health care, civil services (e.g. administrative or police) and does not stay at home, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] If the student's parents live together, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the number of absences. If the student has a high number of absences (more than 21), the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] If the student belongs to the older part of the class (older than 19 years), the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the number of failed classes. If the student has failed no class or only one class, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the number of failed classes. If the student has failed exactly 2 classes, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the number of failed classes. If the student has failed three classes or more, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the student's family size. If the student's family size is rather small (less or equal to three), the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the student's health status. If the student has an average health status, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] If the student is willing to to take higher education, the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] If the student takes extra-curricular paid classes (besides the mandatory ones), the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
Binary [yes / no] Concerning the student's study time away from school. If the student spends little time studying (less than five hours per week), the value for this feature is YES, otherwise NO.
